hero.heading: Equipment and Machinery Leasing
texts: Leasing is a flexible and cost-effective way to acquire the necessary equipment and machinery for your business without large initial investments. On this page, you'll find comprehensive information about the benefits, terms, and practical examples of leasing.

terms.heading: Key Leasing Terms
texts: Leasing contract terms define the contract content and the obligations of the parties. The most important terms concern contract duration, residual value, and maintenance.

vehicles.heading: Leasable Equipment and Machinery
texts: We offer a wide selection of different equipment and machinery for leasing. You can find a suitable solution for almost any industry.

rows: CNC machines, production lines, packaging equipment

benefits.heading: Benefits of Leasing for Business
texts: Leasing offers businesses many significant advantages compared to traditional purchasing or taking a loan.
list: No large initial investments – capital remains available for other uses
Fixed monthly costs make budgeting easier
Opportunity to update equipment at the end of the contract period
Service and maintenance can be included in the contract

examples.heading: Practical Examples
texts: See how leasing has helped businesses in different industries acquire the equipment they need efficiently.

cases.title: Construction Company
texts: A construction company leased three excavators with a 48-month contract. The company was able to start a new project without a large capital investment, and the equipment remained operational thanks to the maintenance contract.

cases.title: Farm Entrepreneur
texts: A farm entrepreneur acquired a new tractor through leasing. The fixed monthly payment made financial planning easier and the machine was quickly available for use.

faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
texts: Answers to the most common questions about equipment and machinery leasing.

questions.question: Can the leased equipment be purchased at the end of the contract period?
questions.answer: Yes, in most cases the equipment can be purchased at a separately agreed residual value.

questions.question: Is maintenance included in the contract?
questions.answer: Maintenance can be included in the contract or arranged separately as needed.

questions.question: How does leasing affect business taxation?
questions.answer: Leasing payments are generally tax-deductible for business taxation.
